channel.title: CVE Feed for BoldGrid -- W3 Total Cache
channel.description: The latest CVEs for BoldGrid -- W3 Total Cache

item.title: CVE-2021-24452|2024-08-03T19:28:23.950Z -- boldgrid -- w3%20total%20cache
item.description: The W3 Total Cache WordPress plugin before 2.1.5 was affected by a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) issue within the "extension" parameter in the Extensions dashboard, when the 'Anonymously track usage to improve product quality' setting is enabled, as the parameter is output in a JavaScript context without proper escaping. This could allow an attacker, who can convince an authenticated admin into clicking a link, to run malicious JavaScript within the user's web browser, which could lead to full site compromise.

item.title: CVE-2021-24427|2024-08-03T19:28:23.956Z -- boldgrid -- w3%20total%20cache
item.description: The W3 Total Cache WordPress plugin before 2.1.3 did not sanitise or escape some of its CDN settings, allowing high privilege users to use JavaScript in them, which will be output in the page, leading to an authenticated Stored Cross-Site Scripting issue

item.title: CVE-2021-24436|2024-08-03T19:28:24.018Z -- boldgrid -- w3%20total%20cache
item.description: The W3 Total Cache WordPress plugin before 2.1.4 was vulnerable to a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) security vulnerability within the "extension" parameter in the Extensions dashboard, which is output in an attribute without being escaped first. This could allow an attacker, who can convince an authenticated admin into clicking a link, to run malicious JavaScript within the user's web browser, which could lead to full site compromise.
